Yes. http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/champion-reveal-kayn Watch the video for the passive, you can see cooldowns on character portrait that you click to transform.

So let's say each transformation starts at a base cooldown of 20 minutes and as you kill ranged champions and collect blue souls (red for melee champs) it reduces that one transformation's cooldown by say 10 seconds per soul collected.

I don't know the actual values but that's an example of how I think it's going to work.

The answer is 'yes.' Generally. Untargetability is not a new mechanic. Zed, Fizz, Vladimir, Rek'Sai, Xayah, and Camille can all use it to avoid skillshots and abilities like Karthus' ult. In the case of Zed and Rek'Sai, they leave the map entirely, similarly to how Kayn does. This ult should be no different.

Also, if he ults someone, and that person gets consumed by Kalista or Tahm Kench, is safe to assume the ult will run it's course without doing damage to the consumed target.
